ch.unifr.pai.twice.utils.cursorSimulator.client.examples
Class CursorSimulation

java.lang.Object
  ch.unifr.pai.twice.utils.cursorSimulator.client.examples.CursorSimulation

public class CursorSimulation
extends java.lang.Object

An example of the functionality for the simulation of multiple mouse pointers following predefined paths on the screen. This is useful for experimenting e.g. with the influence of distraction which is introduced by multiple cursors on the usability of the overall system.

Author:
Oliver Schmid

          The counter of the currently added mouse pointers

          Predefined set of points to which the simulated mouse pointers shall be moved to

Method Detail

addPredefinedLoopCursor

public static void addPredefinedLoopCursor()
Add the next mouse pointers to the application (as long as the limit of the loopCursors. The mouse pointer will immediately start to move and will move to the first coordinates as soon as it has reached the end of the predefined coordinates (looping)

m

public static MouseMovement m(int x,
                              int y,
                              int duration)
Factory method for a mouse movement

Parameters:
x - destination X-coordinate
y - destination Y-coordinate
duration - of the movement
Returns:
MouseMovement object

addSimulatedCursor

public static void addSimulatedCursor()
Adds a cursor that follows a random path on the screen and start the movement immediately.
